statement: Suppose f: R -> R is a continuous function such that f''(x) > 0 for all x in R. Prove that f is unbounded.

hypothesis.value: a continuous function from R to R such that f''(x) > 0 for all x in R

proof.value: slope of the secant lines as x approaches infinity
slope of the secant lines as x approaches negative infinity

proof.proof-method: Definition of convex functions with positive second derivative.

proof.statement: f being convex implies f is unbounded if bounded

proof.assertion: all x is in all numbers:
